title.narrative: Health and Gender Support Project for Cox s Bazar district

description.narrative: Improve the access to and utilization of HNP and GBV response services among the host and the displaced Rohingya population in Cox’s Bazar district.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of Bangladesh

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual end date of the activity

Planned start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Commitment in First Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2021
Total Disbursement in Second Quarter of 2022
Total Disbursement in Third Quarter of 2021

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I.A: The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is included in a dedicated Operational Plan to be approved bythe appropriate Steering Committee at the MOHFW; which Operational Plan shall separate out the interventions of the Project fromtheoverall Recipient’s health program implemented through the other Operational Plans.

Schedule 2, Section I.A: The Recipient shall ensure the carrying out of joint Annual Program Reviews of the Recipient’s Health,Population, and Nutrition sector program, of which this Project is part, with other development partners assisting in the Cox'sBazar District.
Schedule 2, Section I.B: The Recipient shall ensure the Project is carried out in accordance with the ESCP, in a manner acceptableto the Association.
Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall ensure that the Project excludes any activities related to repatriation or relocationof DRP .
Schedule 2, Section II: The Recipient shall furnish to the Association each Project Report not later than 90 days after the end ofeach calendar year.

title.narrative: Number of cases screened for type II diabetes mellitus at the CCs in CXB district (disaggregated By gender)
Number of cases screened for hypertension at the CCs in CXB district (disaggregated by gender)
Number of cases in CXB screened for Tuberculosis (disaggregated by host and DRP)
Number of UH&FWCs in CXB district having no stock-out of 4 modern contraceptive methods in preceding three months
Percentage of cases (complaints), received via the GRM (Grievance Redress Mechanism), that are resolved
Number of CCs in CXB district with a functioning CSGs
Number of six monthly supervision/monitoring visits by the officials of ministries and directorates at facilities
Number of quarterly coordination meetings held among MOHFW and MOWCA officials at the district level
Number of quaterly supervision visits undertaken by district officials (CS, DDFP and DDWA) to review program implementation at the upazilla level and below
Number of children 0-23 months who received IYCF counselling at UH&FWCs of CXB district
Number of women receiving emergency contraceptive pills from CCs, UH&FWCs, UzHCs and MCWC in CXB district
Number of health facilities in CXB providing GBV response services
Number of women and girls referred from one stop crisis cells to one stop crisis center
Number of facility staff who have received training for GBV response services
Number of women and girls utilizing GBV response services from the health facilities in CXB district (disaggregated by host and DRP)
Number of women and girls among the DRP in CXB receiving psych-social counselling services through WFS
Number of MOHFW facilities in CXB district providing 24/7 normal delivery
Number of cases received services from all community clinics in CXB district (disaggregated by gender)
Number of children (0-11 months) in CXB district who have received three doses of pentavalent vaccines (disaggregated by gender, host and DRP)
